page.title: 03CALKE PARK
page.content: This 1000 acre park, to the south of Ticknall, provides an ideal setting for Calke Abbey & is owned by the National Trust. The majority of the park is grazing land for sheep, including the rare Portland breed,cows and deer.Fallow & red deer are enclosed near the abbey.Roe deer,for which a shelter has been provided, run freely. To the north are a chain of ponds which contain rudd, gudgeon & tench. Beyond that the land is rougher ground covered with bracken. There are many ancient plantations of deciduous woodland & a few conifers. The park became open to the public in October 1985. There is one road through the park from Ticknall to Calke and several internal tracks.
